title: MOTOROLA G40 Fusion (Dynamic Gray, 128 GB)  (6 GB RAM)

product_specification.In The Box: Handset, Charger, USB Cable, SIM Tool, User Guides, protective case
product_specification.Other Display Features: 120Hz Refresh Rate, 20.5:9 Display Aspect Ratio, Active Area-Touch Panel (AA-TP): 84.69%, Anti Fingerprint Coating, Water Repellent Design, HDR10
product_specification.Primary Camera Features: Triple Rear Camera Setup: 64 MP Main (Quad Pixel Technology) + 8 MP Ultra-wide Angle and Macro Vision (f/2.2 Aperture, 1.0μm Pixels, FOV 117 Degree) + 2 MP Depth Camera, Features: Shot Optimization, Auto Smile Capture, Gesture Selfie, Smart Composition, HDR, Timer, Active Photos, Pro Mode, Portrait Mode, Cutout, Macro, Spot Color, Cinemograph, Panorama, Live Filter, High-Res Zoom, RAW Photo Output, Best Shot, Google Lens Integration, Video Features: Macro Video, Slow Motion Video, Time-Lapse Video, Hyperlapse Video, Spot Color
product_specification.Secondary Camera Features: 16 MP Front Camera, Features: HDR, Timer, Face Beauty, Auto Smile Capture, Gesture Selfie, Shot Optimization, Active Photos, Pro Mode, Portrait Mode, Spot Color, Cinemograph, Group Selfie, Live Filter, Video Features: Timelapse Video, Hyperlapse Video
product_specification.Video Recording Resolution: Rear Main Camera: UHD (at 120/30 fps), Full HD (at 240/60/30 fps), HD (at 360 fps), Rear Ultra-wide Angle/Macro Camera: Full HD (at 30 fps), Front Camera: UHD (at 30 fps), Full HD (at 240/60/30 fps), HD (at 360 fps)
product_specification.Sensors: Fingerprint Sensor, Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer, Ambient Light Sensor
product_specification.Upgradable Operating System: Assured Upgrade to Android 12 and 2 Years Security Update
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year on Handset and 6 Months on Accessories

product_description.Fast and Efficient Processor: Featuring an efficient Snapdragon 732G processor, this smartphone delivers fast graphics, making your gaming experience seem realistic. Also, with its 6 GB of RAM, you can multitask between apps seamlessly.
product_description.Smooth and Vivid Display: Be it videos, movies, or games, this smartphone ensures that every bit of content comes to life on its 17.2 cm (6.8) Max Vision display. The display is HDR10-compatible, offering enhanced color, brightness, and contrast. What’s more, with a 120 Hz refresh rate, you can enjoy a smooth and lag-free scrolling experience, taking your gaming and browsing experience to the next level.
product_description.Stunning Rear Quad-function Camera: Every beautiful moment that you see can be captured in all its beauty on this moto g40 fusion smartphone as it features a 64 MP quad-function camera system. The sensor offers two incredible perspectives as the two-in-one 8 MP ultra-wide lens and the 8 MP macro vision lens help you capture more of the image in a single frame, while also capturing stunning close-up shots.
product_description.Safety and Privacy Features: Thanks to ThinkShield for mobile, you can rest assured that your data is safe from malicious cyber attacks. You can enjoy an end-to-end solution with its enhanced security features and multiple layers of protection.
product_description.Monstrous 6000 mAh Battery: If you like to play games, watch your favorite TV series, video chat with friends, and do more without having to stay plugged in, then this phone is the one for you as it comes with a massive 6000 mAh battery that offers an impressive runtime of about 54 hours on a single full charge. If the battery goes low, you can quickly juice it up via the 20 W TurboPower charging.
product_description.Large Storage Space: Store your favorite photos, videos, and more on this smartphone without having to delete any of your precious memories as it offers an inbuilt storage space of about 128 GB. If you’re running out of space, you can expand its storage space to about 1 TB via a microSD card.
product_description.Near-stock Android 11 OS: As this smartphone runs on the Near-stock Android 11 OS, you can enjoy a bloatware- and add-free user experience. You can also easily manage conversations, adjust the privacy settings, and do more with ease.
product_description.Water-repellent Design: Don’t worry about accidental spills or splashes of water ruining this device as it features a water-repellent design. This design ensures that your phone is protected from the inside and the outside.
product_description.Stunning and Elegant Design: With the moto g40 fusion smartphone in your hands, you are sure to receive a ton of compliments from your friends and onlookers, thanks to its beautiful design. Additionally, while its tinted housing encompasses the rear cameras, the slim bezel offers more viewing area, making it a delight to use this phone.
product_description.Supports Google Assistant: With simple voice commands, you can make this smartphone work for you. All you need to do is, press the dedicated button that’s located on the side of your phone. This button enables voice control, allowing you to ask the Google Assistant for the answers to your questions.

review:
so finally if you end up reading my review
hear me out

1)CAMERAS
Stock Camera : AVERAGE
GCAM mod : AMAZING
The stock camera app is feature rich

VIDEOGRAPHY : AMAZING
EIS is very good
#you can switch between ultrawide and main camera simultaneously while recording video
But the clarity and colors are not good

2)BATTERY: EXCELLENT
At 120Hz mode ~5hrs of sot at 50% battery left

3)CHARGING : AVERAGE
20 watt charger, OKAISH - 7% per 10 minutes
But it Supports Power delivery charging and charges 10% per 10 minute with a PD charger

It has overcharge protection + optimised charging feature as well

5)DISPLAY: GOOD (HDR10)
its a very good display in itself
plenty bright in daylight
but colors are dull and you wont have deep blacks like in amoled

6)SPEAKERS: GOOD
DUAL SPEAKERS SHOULD HAVE BEEN THERE
boring single speakers
but loud and clear

7)SOFTWARE WITH 120HZ : EXCELLENT
Its been buttery smooth in my daily usage
stock android 11
Its consistent, smooth and feels like one plus flagship
There are some minor bugs here and there
The phone also focuses on privacy and security

8)DESIGN :GOOD
The design is very boring, dynamic grey looks cheap and ugly
frosted champagne looks good
But everything is plastic

9)BUILD :SOLID
the device feels very solid almost feeks like matte glass
It weighs around 220 grams which is just stupid
Put the case on and it's a weight lifting dumbbell 😂

But you will get use to it in an hour
There is no pre applied screen protector
It doesnt have a recognised protection
moto claims, it has gg3 level protection
But moto has great reputation for build quality

OVERALL(The phone gets the basics right)

WHY I WENT AHEAD WITH MOTO G40?
I got it for my father
wanted a phone that could last 3 years
clean and smooth experience
didnt want to get into hastle of bugs as simple as proximity sensor
miui looks and feels in these budget device is bad and updates has been crippling devices after a year(couldn't go with redmi note 10pro)

At the end it all depends on users
And moto is for different types of users who care about user experience

UPDATE 2:
Short review after 3 months of usage
A major bug is fixed (touch improved, Bootloader unlockable)
The cameras are improved
focus hunting issue in video fixed
GCAM support is great
Display is smoother and touch response improved

UPDATE 3:
December
The phone is running like it was on first day
There are some minor bugs here and there
There was a battery drain issue but after reset it was fixed
Haptics are good!
Runs at November security patch
Lack of compass and NFC does bother me a lot!

I'll give a detailed review after using the phone for a week.

Pros :-
1. Big 6000mAh battery
2. Ad and bloatware free near-stock Android OS with the latest update
3. Customisable user friendly UI
4. Nice clear camera (I'm not a camera person but I liked both the front and rear cameras and the options which we have in the camera app)

Cons :-
1. For those who haven't used big screens like me, getting used to this screen will take a while.
2. Moto promised an upgrade till Android 12 but they didn't comment about anything after that. They need to be clear about that like other brands like Samsung, Nokia, etc.)

Didn't find any other cons after that.
After all this, I think it's a good phone.

Performs admirebly well in most scenarios, thanks to the clean UI. The real-world performance is impressive and sails out with ease in day-to-day tasks as well as gaming.

Camera is good in daylight scenarios but lags behind in low light.

Everything else is impressive, be it network reception, call quality, outdoor visiblity, battery performance or speaker output.

I wish the phone was a compact one.

You will fall in love with how the phone works literally !!
Performance is butter smooth, internet is blazing fast, downloads and installs are pretty quick.
Camera is good you'll just need to get used to clicking pictures with moto because it requires some practice.
A lil bit heavy but you'll get used to it in a day and after all it is power packed so you won't mind it much.
Definitely go for it, it's a perfect phone with clean UI.
Lots of Love to Moto for this !!
In one word it's worth buying this phone ... battery is good and charger is also turbo so it takes 1hr to 1.5hr to fully charged .and last but not the least camera quality is super .......

Very big screen and little bulky. But very good mobile.
Any how we make it bulky by putting a fancy case. But screen is so big and it might need 2 hands.

Whatever, stock Android, awesome price range, good features. Definitely value for money.

Ordered 2 more after seeing first one.

From a student point of view,(after 1week of use)

It was really great from.batyery as a full charge last almost 26-28hrs (with useage). Display is good. Buy can't say anything about gaming. And as i am a moto user previously also its easy to manuever this device. Really liked the notification feature of Android 11. But there no option to reduce screen size to one hand mode as it was available for new moto g series. And there is no option to customise Assistant button.

Overall its a great purchase. Hope screen guard and good cover will come soon.
Motorola is very awesome phone. As well as I'm using Motorola since 2013 it is launching very good phones .it has very good camera and crazy' performance and many more

Adding this comment after 4 days of heavy use
First thing to mention is the battery backup. Lasted for 3 days without gaming.

Camera is good enough and is stable. If you're looking for a better camera, go for G60, has the same specs but 108mp camera. Rest is the same

Speakers are working nice at high volumes and have a good pitch to it.

Ui is stock android 11 with latest updates installed. It is pretty smooth and free of bloatware which is not the case with poco and mi phones. But if you're from the background of any of the above 2, (like I am), you'll find some useful features absent here,, like floating window, blurring aap in task manager preview mode and others fancy things. But life can go on without these hassle-free anyways.

Phone is little bulky when compared to others but that shouldn't be concerning as we always use heavy back covers. Screen is very big, so if you're looking for a big screen (people with big hands will find this phone appealing) go for it.
Screen refresh rate is 120heartz, which is unusual at this price range. Really feels smooth and fluid.

Only con is that the battery capacity is 6000mah and to charge a massive battery like this, motorola should have provided atleast a 33 watt charger instead of 20watt.
And yes, a notification light would have been a nice add-on :)

Overall: low budget, maximum battery, good performance and a big screen with smooth stock ui. I guess that's all you need for day to day work.

Previously i used moto phone for 2 and half years (Moto one power) which is still working superb,, recently i changed the battery and all good,,
That's why i am choosing moto again,
Moto g40 fusion 6/128 (Frosted champagne)
I am using this device from 6th Oct 2021

Here i am talking about some points, that u should Consider

1. IN HAND FILL:- This phone is tall slightly heavy and bulky too, if you use cover with it. But after sometime u will get used to it, not a big deal.

2. CAMERA:- Daylight photo or in naturel lighting condition it is good but in night or low light performance not good,,

3. AUDIO:- when i was searching review about this phone i try to find some audio review about loudspeaker and headphone but nobody talk about it,, my previous moto device loudspeaker quality is good but headphone jack quality not very impressive,
This device has a mono speaker and its good but not very impressive, my previous moto device has better loudspeaker comparing to this
Headphone jack output is good if u adjust equalizer and use good quality headphones.
In calls earpiece is ok and loud enough

4. They giving security patch update in quarterly
Patch is still on July 1, 2021

Some points what i likes
1. Moto gesture

2. Performance 732G great,, easily handle heavy task no lag no heating problem

3. Awesome battery 🔋 easily give u 10 hours of screen on time

4. Charging speed is ok with 20w charging,, 2 hours plus to 100% but its ok because of optimize night charging feature is there to charge the phone overnight, it will protect your battery

5. Screen is big and good, viewing angle is also good. For multimedia consumption its perfect. Outdoor visibility is ok

6. 120 hz display is smooth. Once u used it u can clearly see the difference between 120hz and 60hz

7. It has Carriar aggregation (4g+) i got 4g+ in jio in my area (Airtel not provide 4g+ in my area)

8. Fingerprint print sensor is fast and reliable

9. Awesome Ram management

10. Vibration motor is slightly good,, its not like old one. When you type it feels smooth and premium

11. No bloatware, no bugs, no unwanted notifications. Simple UI close to stock android

Tips:-
If u need good performance (for games) and good ram management then go for 6/ 128 and if u need higher camera and NFC go for G60

Go for Frosted Champagne colour it has matt finish back. Fingerprint or smudges are not easily attract comparing to Dynamic gray.
Dynamic gray color verient has glossy finish its attract smudge easily.

The phone is exactly as I expected. No disappointment at all. I would recommend buying the G40 Fusion instead of G60 because the camera is almost the same. I exchanged my G6 for this and got a great price. Charging is a bit slow. I usually charge it at night so I don't feel the charging rate. After a week of usage my review is
Pros:
1. Camera is good in daylight.
2. Sound system is good and offers audio styling as well.
3. Build quality is nice.
4. Clean UI is its best feature. No "un-deletable" bloatware.
120Hz refresh rate works like a treat.
Phone feels premium to hold.
5. 6000mAh battery lasts more than 2 days on decent usage

Cons:
1. Might heat up a little when using while charging.
2. The Google assistant button is a waste. (Why press a button when you can activate the assistant by just saying "Hey Google"?)
3. Even though the back looks amazing, without the cover, it's a bit of a fingerprint magnet.

Note: weight of the phone is not very noticeable. The first time you hold the phone it might seem heavy, but you get used to it within hours

Phone has many pros and cons, pros include good display, terrific battery life, good gaming experience and an absolute treat to use stock android. Cons include camera it could have been a bit better at this price range there are better camer phones than the phone is a bit bulgy but if you look at the pros than it's fine to trade off with this con. Overall a good product at this price range. Must buy if you are looking for mid range non chinese mobile phone with a secure stock android OS unlike the chinese UI which offer less security and more data breach.

This is very good phone with sd 732g at this price. It camera is very good. Battery very good. Display very big. And clear picture quality. And clean and clear UI system with android one. I love this phone. My first moto g40 fusion is very fast. Love to play battle grounds mobile india and this phone handle very smoothly all the game purpose. Very premium look.

Anyone who is hesitating bcz of the weight beleive me I also have the tension about the weight but when I unboxed and took it in my hand I was totally surprised (also to be mentioned that I'm moving from a 5 inches phone) , it is lighter and handy than I expected.
Os is fantastic bcz I'm moving from miui . Though there is not a lot features like miui but every essential day to day usage features are there I'm not facing any kind of problem .The experience with the os on 120hz screen is so buttery smooth .
Performance is also nice. No overheating
Camera I would say in the price range it captures decent photos even with the wide angle camera
The haptics on the keyboard is very good.
My favourite and most useful feature is peek display it's almost like an always on display.
At the end I would say if anyone like me want to move on from Miui then definitely go for this you wouldn't regret it

Hi guys, yesterday only I have received the product from Flipkart, ans it’s a big surprise for me that opening of the box I found the phone totally handy while in many reviews on YouTube it was informers that’s it’s so heavy and very thick but it’s not at all like that. Yes due to the 6.78” screen and 6000 mah battery it’s big but not that bulky.
I love the display of this phone as it’s so smooth to use and the stock android experience is always amazed.
Camera of the phone is also good in performance.
Sometime I feels very minor lags otherwise it’s working awesome.
In this price range u can’t buy any other device like this for sure. So just go for it.

3. No battery issues or heating up probs so far🤞...charges faster on flight mode or from a power bank
4. Perfect for daily regular use...haven't used it much for gaming

6. Audio...good..speakers /microphone
7. Not really heavy ...I love the display size and find it handy within a few days of use
8.fits in jeans pocket & medium size purses
That's all I know..not much of a technically detailed review...I am happy...good for a regular user...worth the price🙂

First of all I have to wait 11days to get this mobile .. delayed by flipkart or by its seller side which was very frustrating when to need an product in emergency.

I was using previously Motorola G5s+ since 2017 which was an good experience in all factor which fulfilled my expectations,this was reason to go with moto again.

Pros:-
-Good battery,last you for sure 2 days if you're moderate user
-Friendly user interface, without any blot ware or any other unwanted junk.
-Display is big, it's good but not excellent. If it was amoled display then 5/5.
-Moto quality and durability (depends on user)
-Wifi calling and network carrier aggregation which is very helpful and must feature.
- looks (depends individual's choice)
- 120 hdz refesh rate.
- performance good sd732G

Cons-
- camera is average,if your expectations are high. Front camera take above average pics
- big punch hole camera size,which can small or minimum.
- finger print scanner, which back is mounted at back panel is very outdated. If it was side mounted then 👍.
- compass 🧭 sensor missing,but not big issue.
-little bit heavy side, but you will get used to it.

Overall- If your looking for a mobile with good battery, performance and smooth user interface without any blot ware then go for it.


Happy shopping 😀..

The phone is just amazing and you will not experience any problems with it except for the camera. Camera is just plain bad, the macro is actually pretty good but other than that the 64 MP main shooter and the ultrawide will not provide you with good images.

Writing this review after using 4 months.
Everybody knows pros of this phone, like good battery & processing power but I’m talking about cons:
Too big display that won’t fit in your pocket.

Writing this review after 5 days of usage.

Short Review: If your main priorities are stock android, a good processor and a decent camera, go for it.

Pros:
1. Big display and near AMOLED-like colours. Previously I was using a IPS LCD screen itself so I was okay with IPS LCD. Nevertheless the quality of the screen is superb.
2. Battery - according to my usage (online meetings, music, COD mobile for 30 minutes) it lasted about 1 and a half day. With light usage it will easily give more than 2 days of battery life and charging speed is quite good. Slow charging is safe too :)
3. Weight distribution - If you're hesitating because of its size and weight, don't worry. The weight distribution is superb and within a few days you'll get used to it and other phones will feel light. It also fits easily in any jeans pocket.
4. Stock Android - Awesome experience. Only Google apps were there and some Motorola customization apps which don't take up much space. So you're getting 112GB of free space out of the box (For the 128GB variant). And of course, no ads, junk or bloatware.
5. Durability - This phone is built like a tank! Very strong and sturdy.
6. Security - As you may know this comes with ThinkShield Mobile 4-layered hardware and software security so the phone is quite safe compared to chinese phones. Yes, Motorola is owned by Lenovo (which is chinese) but our data is stored in Motorola's U.S servers. So in security, this is a very good phone.
7. Plastic back is of premium quality and I took the Frosted Champagne colour and this one even resists fingerprints!

Cons:
1. Camera night shots could be improved a bit. Daylight shots are beautiful considering the price point and macro is just mind-blowing. Only night shots are a bit dull and can be improved.
2. Hybrid SIM slot - this is not a con for me as I use a single SIM but for people who use two SIM cards and a microSD card, this is a problem.
3. Misses stereo speakers although the mono-speaker is quite loud and clear.
4. People with small hands will find it difficult using this phone. People with average sized palms won't have much problem but you cannot use it one-handed.
5. You might have problem seeing the display outdoors with strong sunlight. You need to find shade and then check your phone.
6. People who want just AMOLED screen only, then this is not a good choice for them.

Overall this is a good value-for-money phone. If your budget is below or around the 15k price mark, then do consider this.

My priorities are 3 things :
1) Performance : Performance is adequate and upto the mark wrt to the price. Stock android also helps in giving a better user experience. It's not blazing fast, but good for day to day use.

2) Battery : Battery is good. Easily can run along the whole day with heavy usage. For moderate users, it will be good for 2 days. Charging is slow and will take 2-2.5 hrs to charge from 10-100.

This is one of the best phones to get at this price range.

Performance:
At this price, I would say this is one of the best performance phones you would get on the market as Motorola provides stock android so that it doesn’t has any bloatware or any unwanted background running processes. This phone uses a Snapdragon 732G which is one of the best 4g processors under 20k so overall performance is smooth and it can also provide above average gaming performance.

Display:
This phone has a 120hz IPS LCD display with HDR10 support. IPS LCD is one of the few cons I see in this phone as some other phones in the same price range provide AMOLED but the video and gaming experience would not affect that much as there is 120hz refresh rate and HDR10 support.

Camera:
The 64MP main sensor produces great quality images but the wide angle and macro produces average images. The wide angle quality can be solved by using a GCAM port. Also it does support video recording up to 4k@30 fps which is pretty good.
[Few camera samples are attached (some images went through basic post processing)]

Battery:
This has a 6000mAh battery which lasts almost 1 and half days with average usage. As this is a stock android phone, battery life is higher compared to other 6000mah phones.

Design:
This phone weighs around 210 grams which is slightly heavier compared to other phones with a similar price tag but you won’t feel it as a heavy phone in hand as it has good weight distribution. It is 9.6 mm thick which is more comparatively and it becomes thicker when it comes with a case.

Pros:
1) 120hz with HDR10 Display
2) Stock Android Experience
3) Good 64MP Main Camera.
4) Good processor for the price.

Cons:
1) Bit heavy & thick
2) LCD Panel (Not AMOLED)
3) 4g Phone (No 5g support)

Had it for one day now. Size of this thing is massive. Will be really hard to maneuver on it for people with small hands. Weight is relatively on the heavier side but you will get used to it really quick. Camera is not that great. After image processing is basically what you get at this price range. Battery is massive and battery life on this thing is amazing. At the time of writing this review been using it for 8 hours after a full charge and it's still got 68% battery left! Carrier aggregation is very impressive. Constantly getting LTE+. Voice on calls is also crystal clear. Haptics of this device don't belong to this price range, feel rather expensive. Fingerprint scanner is good enough. Got big hands so no issues with its placement. Software wise this device is an absolute delight! No bloatware at all. Things I liked in this phone (big thumbs up) - Stock android - big thumbs up to software, no bloat and ad-wares. Phone's weight balance and build quality, Think Shield security, 120 hz refresh rate. Two days battery backup and provision of headphone jack, custom moto gestures and screen size. Proximity sensor.

Things that are missing (thumbs down)-  Phone doesn't come with magnetometer (at least they must include this sensor in future models), No carrier aggregation (I did not find it on my device, maybe this can be unlocked with software upgrade) and NFC. 25 or 30 watt fast charging. Noise cancellation microphone.

Things which need improvement - Ergonomic placement of finger print scanner, due to phone size, front camera punch hole and bezels size also would have been smaller. Hybrid sim slot to triple card slot. Improvement in camera image processing. Didn't like the phone speaker and needs big improvement. Can't play HDR10 videos. Increase in screen brightness for outdoors.

This is my second moto phone.. writing this detailed review after a week's usage. New details are covered here for your better understanding.
Currently, I'm Using Realme 3 Pro(4GB+64GB) which was bought 2 years back. Realme 3 Pro is good in features but somewhat I'm not satisfied with that phone. MI Mobiles were also on the List but heard a lot of display issues, hanging, bloatware, and inferior quality. So Finally I decided to go with this Moto G40.
Moto G40 pros:-
1) Screen size is a little bigger which is good but not needed for everyone
2) Screen quality is the same as Realme 3 Pro, no worries about the quality
3) Clean OS, interesting moto gestures
4) Lot of optimization than Realme 3 Pro (even both phones are having android 11)
5) Call quality is great, signal strength is good, VOLTE calls are good
6) Bluetooth & wi-fi connectivity is also good
7) Interestingly the weight seems lesser than Realme 3 Pro (tried 2 phones in different hands, moto feels lighter than Realme 3 Pro)
8) Phone thickness is of both moto & Realme is same, so no more bulky feel
9) Camera quality is awesome when comparing with Realme 3 Pro. Many people are saying the camera is normal in reviews. those people may have not changed the settings. I tried to take pictures simultaneously in Realme 3 Pro & moto G40, Realme captured fewer details and moto g40 captured details than realme. color is natural in moto, Realme 3 Pro is oversaturated. Moto g40 is the clear winner than realme7.
10) Battery life is like Realme 3 Pro, not seen any difference. withstanding for 1 full day without games. you can optimize the battery, fine-tune app usage details, change refresh rates to extend the battery life
11) 6gb+128GB of moto is charm than 8gb+128GB of realme
12) Build quality is good & sturdy.
13) Sound quality is decent. no complaint.
14) No heat
General:-
1) Tried to charge with 30watts Dart charger of Realme 3 Pro, but moto phone charged like normal and turbocharger mode is not enabled
2) Turbo mode enabled after connected the supplied moto charger. so there is NO support of other branded fast charger
3) I liked the backside finger sensor option (my previous honor 8 pros is also having a back fingerprint sensor). Side finger sensor is not convenient in Realme 3 Pro, screen unlocking frequently while holding the mobile in hand. so, I'm okay with a back sensor.
Cons:-
1) They supplied a transparent case is having sharp outer edges and is irritating while attending calls
2) Seller delayed the shipment and Flipkart delivery was pathetic this time. Anyhow this is not related to the product
3) 30watts / 60 watts fast charger is preferable at this price
not found any other issue.
Conclusion:-
This is better than Realme 3 Pro, Redmi Note 10 Pro, and other similar models. Trusted brand, super build quality, nice battery, and good weight balance. The camera quality is also very good at this price. You can go ahead with this model without any hesitation.

Okay so, I got this phone yesterday and I have been using this for a while now and the first impressions that I got were that this is a huge device. Now, by huge I mean to say that the display size and width of the device is a bit large, but weight of the phone as told by many reviewers, it's not that much, even if it is, still you won't feel like holding a heavy device. If you compare it with some average mobile phone(Redmi 5, my previous phone) it is heavy but not to the extent that you can't use it, usage is difficult in matters of screen. Also having a back fingerprint seems odd nowadays.
Talking about the processor and the phone's performance now, it is good. Here I should mention that I haven't played any heavy games on this phone, and neither do I intend to but it will handle them efficiently, because using several apps at once, I didn't find any lags, hanging issues or heating problems as such. For a general user who consumes some multimedia and does some day to day work on his phone, this device shall not give any problems.
Battery has performed a bit odd, it's draining rather more than it should, but maybe it's due to the fact that I have locked the screen at 120Hz and this is a big phone.
Basic features like calling are good, no problems with the proximity sensor or any other thing, I have heard that there is no compass, but it's not problems, for me though, maps is working fine, only thing is you won't be able to see is where you're facing.
The camera I would say is average, not bad, but average, I'm not much of a camera guy as I rarely click pictures but for someone who uses camera a lot and pictures are really important, I would suggest looking for something else.
Rest all is good, UI is very clean, lacks features like app lock and many others(like those you get in MIUI) but had they been there the whole point of stock android would have rendered invalid.
My final suggestion would be that, if you can take the risk of having "some" ads and bloatware and can keep up with issues like occasional heating, go for Redmi Note 10 Pro; It's far better and that too only because of its physical appearance, I say this because a mobile device which ain't easy to carry and use is no good because that's what a mobile is meant to be, small, compact and easily usable. But if general security, software and a feeling of having almost no basic problems(like heating, calling etc.) matter to you then go for Moto G40 fusion because this thing is all you can ask for in this price, and at this price you will have to compromise on something to get something, here in this case the physical appearance.
Not uploading any pictures as they would get pixelated anyways, so no point of uploading them.

Review after 5 days of usage
Typing this review in moto g40 fusion 6gb 128gb dynamic grey varient

1) Perfomance / software (5/5): At this price range this phone gives you the best performance since it has clean and neat stock android experience and no ads or bloatwares like miui or realme poco etc. Powered with Snapdragon 732g it is just smooth and flawless (better processor when compared to Exynos and mediatek which we get at this price range).

2) Display (4/5): Best thing is it's 120hz display and it's FHD+ display but not AMOLED display, so colors are not that vibrant and punchy, but gets the job done. Screen size is very big (6.8) so it might feel bulky with big screen. This phone is not for someone who likes compact and small phones.

3) Battery (5/5): It has tremendous 6000mAh battery and easy last long for more than one day with moderate usage. Since it is stock android the battery won't drain quickly and it is power efficient. Since it has got large battery and big screen, it is very thick and bulky (220gms), but weight management is done very well, so you will get adjusted to it quickly. Then about charging we get 20watt fast charger, it's not very fast but it's decent since battery is 6000mAh.

4) Storage (5/5): 6gb, 128gb is more than sufficient (4gb, 64gb I doubt), RAM management is done very well since it is stock android and internal storage we get 115gb free (in case of 128gb), since no pre installed bloatwares, storage is not a issue here.

5) Camera (3/5): Camera are not that good because we get better camera at this price range (samsung), but it's decent and it has lot of features like night camera, macro, etc. If you want a camera phone, then this is not a good phone for you. But it's good for day to day usage.

6) Design / Build quality (4/5): The varient which I choose is very good and gives premium look, but it is finger print magnet and it's made of plastic. Build quality is very good looks sturdy with splash proof (haven't tried).

7) Speakers (3/5): They are loud but not stereo speakers and earpiece is very loud so that the back panel starts to vibrate if you keep at high volume. The 3.5mm headphone jack output is also not that great but decent.

8) Gaming (5/5): If you are a gamer then this phone is for you, 120hz refresh rate, large battery and fast processor, you can play lag free.

9) Call quality and network (internet) (5/5): Call quality is good and loud and even clear. Internet quality is very fast and download takes place within seconds. And also comes with hybrid sim slot

10) Finger print sensor (4/5): It's accurate but takes times to unlock. Side mounted finger print would have been better.

11) Other features (5/5): It has very cool gestures by moto like turning on camera and flash light and even some smart features from Google. A dedicated seperate physical button to launch google assistant and sadly it's not customisable.

12) Overall (4/5): It is good phone at this price range with good performance and stock android ui with decent camera performance.

•07/10 Build Quality: It has plastic back instead of glass. It doesn't feel heavy!!! even though the phone is almost A centimeter thick but it is big in size too so it doesn't look bulky 20.5/9 aspect ratio makes it a long phone.
Only Cons I found is lack of sAMOLED.

Excellent phone from Motorola. There's all the pros you can have, I'll mention the cons.

- The phone is bulky. And you add a cover, it makes it even bulkier.
- The phone is heavier than average phones, but considering the hardware on offer I don't mind.
- The screen size is too long. It's a 6.8 inch display, forget single handed operation.
- Being a motorola, you'll have a tough time sourcing accessories. You won't find any covers or screen guards easily in local shops, and I stay in Mumbai. So only option for accessories is online.

Pros being the battery, the display, the device, gaming is good, charge time is good. Overall if you are thinking wether to buy or not, go for it.

A great phone..... Big battery life (charge it to 90 to 95 percent and use it for the whole day)..... Good for gaming..... Camera is not great.... But I think future updates will resolve the issues.... It is a bit heavy..... But the phone is perfect at this price range...

This review is after almost 2 weeks of use.

PROS:
1. Good display even though it's not an AMOLED screen, the 120hz feels smooth and responsive and the color and viewing angles are decent.

2. The phone is fast and snappy and has no problems multitasking and switching between multiple apps. There are certain apps where there is a slight lag but overall the
phone is fast and efficient.

3. Clean android 11 experience with Motorola's MYUI is way better than any custom UI out there, it is fast, efficient, and simple with almost no bloatware. though it lacks
certain customization options if you are coming from MIUI, ONEUI, etc. but it can easily be solved by 3rd party apps available on playstore.

4. Good battery back-up, lasts almost a whole day on my use (fairly heavy usage) and still has some juice left at the end of the day. I had no issues gaming and
streaming the whole day.

5. Camera is decent for the price, the pictures are sharp and clear though low light photography could have been better.

CONS:
1. The size (6.8inches) can be pretty huge for some people, the phone is on the heavier side, it's balanced well but people with small hands will find it difficult to use.
one-handed operation is also quite difficult.

2. The google button is mostly useless and it's placed above the volume buttons which makes it irritating because it gets pressed when changing volume. It should have
been placed on the opposite edge.

3. Fingerprint sensor is placed on the back, it could have been a side-mounted one, as most phones are these days.

4. The camera and the camera software could have been a little better, as it takes some time to process the pictures.

5. Gaming performance is average, BGMI and COD runs fairly well on medium-high settings without any heating and or lag, The fps drops a little while playing Genshin
Impact or any other demanding games. So not suitable for heavy or extended periods of gaming.

Final review:
Overall the phone is awesome and a complete value for money. The overall experience using it has been good as I prefer my phone to be clean, simple, and functional without any ads or bloatware. If you are tired of all those bloatware and ad ridden UIs, Motorola's UI will be a fresh breath of change for you. At this price range, Motorola G40 FUSION is the perfect phone which does not cut many corners when it comes to performance and functionality.

If you have a budget of Rs21000-25000, I would suggest going for Motorola Edge20 FUSION as it addresses many of the problems of this phone and also is 5G ready.

Very good phone. Very good camera, Display, Battery, Prosser. Fast delivery. All must buy. Thank you Motorola. Thank you Flipkart for this phone, and the discount and offer.

Thermal Review: (3/5)*
Tried CPU Stress Test and it is reaching 85c - 90c in the cores of the CPU... Overall Product feels slightly warmer than rest of the phones even with light usage. (This maybe due to high temperature in CPU core, which leads to throttling of performance)

*Might be possible that I received a defective model which is overheating, so I can't confirm if this is the case for everyone or not... (Please reach out to me and confirm if this is happening for everyone or not)

My Geekbench Score: Single Core: 557, Multi Core: 1494


Ram Management: (4/5)
Really good. Better than usual competitors like Realme and Xiaomi out there.

Display: (4/5)
Even if not AMOLED, you can't go wrong with this screen! It's gorgeous to look at. The phone doesn't feel as narrow as you imagine it to be...

Cameras: (2.5/5)
Good daylight photos but with oversharpening but still decent to look at. However, in Low light performance for video is absolute disaster. Even my 4 year old Moto g5 Plus with 12.2MP (f/1.7) camera had better details and lower noise than the usual camera application provided in Moto g40 fusion.
I won't recommend this phone to camera enthusiasts out there. But those who are okay with that can still use Gcam and get better results from it.

Battery: (4.5/5)
It's just absolute beast! Got 8.5 hours of Screen on time with 35% juice still remaining but I decided to charge it. (My usage does not involve gaming)

Final Thoughts:
Overall in my 2 day usage I'd recommend this to anyone who requires a phone with very good performance and best ram management in its price segment with STOCK UI.

I Have been using this phone from past 15 days...below is what I feel about this product..

Pros :
1) Battery - There is no need to worry about charging and all...6000 MAH is good enough...even for heavy user it will last for day or so.
2) Display is much better than what I have expected...Good Display.
3) Screen Size - If you consume lots of connect online this is a bliss..when you are used to this screen size and look at other phones they look bit small.
4) Camera - It's decent..does the Job.
5) UI - One of the main selling point..not ads or stuff..clean user interface..
6) Processer - It's Good for Gaming...No Lags or anything..it was smooth..

Cons :
1) Weight : THIS IS A HEAVY PHONE - Intially i thought it's like any other phone while holding it..but as the days went by I am getting the feel that this phone is heavy....if you are holding your phone and scrolling through social media you hands with pain a bit...you can't hold this phone for longer durations.
2) Lag - Noticed Minor Lags while using Camera app and Few apps (rarely) stop working...you need to close and reopen...and If you are using WhatsApp and sending any Image directly from the app... except some delay of 2-3 seconds..untill the image is processed.
3) Camera - Did notice some disturbance in images when you zoom in for an Image which you took. Not sure why they have provided a dummy camera(the third camera doesn't work).
4) Apps : No Gallery App or Phone dailer Pre-Installed...You need to look for a Good Gallery app from Playstore.
5) Screen Brightness : Outdoors on a Sunny day...you might struggle to view your phone...in Terms of Brightness in this phone .. it could have been bit better.

First and foremost, never choose a smartphone based on pure specifications on paper. Moto g40 fusion seems to be a steal deal for one who looks for a Snapdragon 732g phone but it doesn't have any ergonomic design.
First few days of using the phone you have to adjust to the heavyweight of the phone.
Major pros:
1) On paper has good value for money specifications
And that's all for me in that.
Major Cons:
1) Heavyweight
2) Poor build quality, the phone literally makes creaking sound when you accidentally touch the back panel
3) Poor overall design, when you move around your palms across the phone, you can feel the irregularities near the display and body joint which is strange for a 2021 phone from a brand like this( just for name sake it is Motorola, it's just a phone made in Padget electronics)
4) Power button stopped it's working after a month's of use.
5) My 2019 Nokia 5.1 plus has better camera than this moto 64 mp gimmick.

So I have very poor impressions on this product, eventhough some brands use less powerful processors at this price range they are atleast having good build quality (eg:samsung from our experience).

Highly satisfactory purchase.
The phone will rarely impress you, but never disappoints.
The Display is large, saturated, and the 120Hz really shines. It could do with higher brightness, however.
The camera really shines with Gcam. The photos are crisp with natural colours.Night Sight on Gcam is brilliant as well
The battery might seem huge, but with a 6.8 inch 120 Hz display to power, it again, is satisfactory.
The speakers are loud enough, bottom firing is a bit annoying as they do tend to get covered up
The performance is really the top aspect. 6gb of ram with the 732G , couples with 120 Hz and it really feels like you're blazing through apps.
It can be difficult to operate with one hand, and is a bit heavy, but you get used to it
Overall I'd say I'm happy with the phone!
The display is not Corning Gorilla glass so may get broken with little drop also. And the battery backup is ok till now using for 6months till now 2 day life with 7hrs screen time and full charge.
Must buy.

Been a moto fan boy since the Moto G2 and since then it’s been just Motorola for the entire family. Recently switched from Moto One power to the G40 and first thing u notice is the Massive Size. It’s easy to hold as it’s not wide but impossible to navigate the whole screen with one hand for people with small to medium hands. Specially ladies might have trouble using this one hand. However u gt used to it in a week.

Coming to the performance and battery life, this is Bingo !!! Stutter free scrolling and faster app opening makes it an ideal budget smart phone. The camera is okay (3.5/5) but not bad. Obviously this is not a camera centric phone.

Watching videos in this aspect ratio feels weird as it blacks out on the left and right. The speakers are loud and clear till u reach the max volume where is sounds a little distorted. However I won’t be at the max volume until ur in loud places. The speaker is loud enough at about half the volume.

The battery is amazing but the charging is slow. A bigger battery needs faster charger which moto is slowly coming upto.

Overall a very good budget smart phone for people with big hands 😉

Although the phone hardware is good enough but operating system is full of glitches. Such as
random ghost touches few times a day(very annoying),
low earphone sound(an issue if taking calls outside home),
refresh rate isn't smooth as 120hz display should be(screen lock, unlock can take more than a second even with disabled animations),
120hz should be smooth, I have to disable the animations to get decent performance.
My friends using the same device are facing same issues so these issues are not unique to my device. Normal user may take a month to observe these issues but leaves review within a week or so. Hence good reviews for this device.
Although, there are workarounds (not fix) for these issues except slow lock/unlock and low call volume but I think the phone is Ok Ok type.
Just for reference: other smartphone brands provide better software experience.

1. Best smart phone in this segment, most features of Redmi Note 10 available which i believe is the competitor

3. The wide screen is good to watch the movies crystal clear

Negatives:

1. Could have had 2 inbuild speakers instead of one for better sound quality
2. Few may feel its hard to carry it in pocket because of the size

Overall it's a very good purchase for the price it was offered. Thank you flipkart.

Moto g40 fusion review: best Redmi killer under 15k

The Motorola g40 fusion is a killer budget mobile I got in the Flipkart bbd 2021. Here are the pros and cons.

Pros:
• The moto MyUx offers a stock android experience without any bloatware or ads, and offers some customisation for the icons and gestures, eg: live wallpapers and a game mode
• This phone’s the most affordable SD732G in India as per the time of this writing.
• The gaming experience for PUBG is superb, with no lags at smooth graphics and ultra-frame rate. For free fire max, experience is smooth.
• Camera app is a little bit cumbersome to use, but the photos are the sharpest quality in the 15k budget. Also, it offers AR stickers and a good night mode.
• 120 Hz refresh rate with FHD+(1440p) resolution is a good choice
• 95 % software is Google services, giving good Google integration.


Cons:
• Heavy weight, large dimension and screen size takes much time getting used to.
• The google one ,Yt music and google tv app cant be uninstalled.
• Overheats a lot while charging and playing game above 30 mins.
• People migrating to Motorola from redmi will miss many features like applock and camera lock screen shortcut (the moto actions has gestures to compensate for that).
• Google photos app ‘s photo editing need paid membership to unlock, but most of the free features are superb and do the trick.

1 Looks & Design-4/5 Looks and design is very good. I like it very much and it looks like a premium phone. Due to the glossy design of the back, fingerprints and scratches are more likely to occur. The display is very good quality, very good for multimedia, punch hole display design gives a very stunning look. Gorilla Glass Protection should be provided which is not provided.
2 Camera-3/5 The features of the camera are very good and give a lot but the 64 megapixel camera does not give such a good result. Before this I had realme 3 pro which had better photos than this.
3 Performance-4/5 Performance is very good yet mobile never hangs. Heavy game can also run very well and in high setting.
4 Bettery-4/5 As the battery is 6000mAh, it can be used all day long, but with the box only a 20 watt charger is provided which takes about two and a half to three hours to charge the mobile full. Nowadays, many companies offer fast chargers with more than 30 watts, even in the lower price range, while a charger with 20 watts cannot be considered as a fast charger.
5 Others Features-3/5 The app lock defect appears inside the feature. The clone app is also not provided.The fingerprint sensor works well but the face unlock features do not work properly. Otherwise the features of Motorola are good which allows you to personalize. And no additional application is provided which is a good thing.

Overall a solid 9/10

After using the device for month, here is the list of pros and cons that I could come up with -
Pros
- Decent specs at a low price.
- Battery life is great. Can easily last 2/2.5 days on average use.
- Camera is good with many useful features.
- Great display with good colour accuracy.
- Good performance. No lags experienced. Fast loading of apps.
- Similar to stock android experience without any extra apps.

Cons
- Size may be a problem for some people. Single hand use is difficult.
- The phone is heavier than average. You can get accustomed to it and after a while it doesn't feel heavy. But if you use a case, it will surely feel heavy and be uncomfortable after long use. For comfortable use, if you aren't clumsy and won't drop it, don't use a case.
- At full volumes, the sound starts to feel noisy and grainy.
- Front camera pictures look bad in artificial lighting. They show innacurate colours and face tone looks very pale.

This phone has a typical background battery usage. Battery is draining very fast, with in 28 hours the battery drained from 100% to 12%. I have used lenovo K6 power with 4000mah battery before this phone which has given a far more better battery experience ( 2 to 3 days) than this 6000mah battery. After turning on Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and location in this phone no logos are appeared / visible on the display area, which is a new experience to me. Either I have to go to the status bar or I have to go to the settings menu to check the Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and location are on or off. This phone doesn't have any default Massage, File Manager or Phone app, this phone is using Google phone, Google Massage and Google Files as default app. It means if any time Google stop their services in India this phone will be a plastic box, which is not expected at this price point.

Good/Pros:
- Stock android, fluidic -great performance
- No undesired pre-installed apps
- Great battery life - lasting around 2 days on 100% charge
- No/minimal fingerprints on screen
- Better camera - realistic photos with less artificial enhancements/corrections
- Camera cut-out mode - excellent
- Advantage front/selfie camera flash - Not mentioned in config
- Average speaker sound quality
- Competitive price

Bad/Cons
- Bit bulky by weight
- Need more brightness in screen
- In menu type - gesture, shows 3 screen edges at bottom - bit ugly
- Google assistant button is waste
- No local marker support - No choice for back cover / unavailable in city like Mumbai. Vendors suggest go online; usual Motorola issues

1. The display is blueish .
2 .Camera is good but below my expectations as moto g turbo has that camera standards . All those years and no upgrade .
3. Charging speed . I mean when other brands are providing 30 watt , 60 watt charging , moto sticked to it's normal turbo charging of maximum upto 20 watts which you can't expect to work in all conditions ( when battery is 80% or device is above 40°)

I don't blame moto but the competition to provide phone with better specs in lower prices .
I would simply prefer a premium moto device or cheap Xiaomi , poco or realme device .

Let me start with the pros:::

1: Massive 6.8 Inch IPS display with HDR 10 support and 120HZ. colors are rich and vibrant. you will love Watching HDR videos on YouTube
2. Massive 6000Mah battery . Will last the entire day with heavy usage. And around 1.5 days with moderate use.
3. Using GCAM the quality of captured images are considerably better. the tone and colors of the photos are natural.
4. You will love gaming on this. Runs BGMi & CODM without breaking a sweat. no frame drops or lags. (54-60 fps on BGMI using GFX tool). A full charge should give you around 8hrs of gaming.
5. Stock Android UI. clean and smooth UI no bloatwares no ads

Cons ::
1. If you are a realme or mi user then this phone will feel heavy . It weighs 225gms
2. I have experience multi touch issues on BGMI. I dont know if its a game issue or the phones' .
3. 20W charger is quite slow. Takes 2.5hrs to charge from 0-100 .
5. Default camera app captures above average pictures.I hope motorola fixes it with an software update.

After using it for one month.

1.Display is good. ( No fault in quality )
2.Processor is very good ( it can handle heavy task)
3.Phone is little big but not heavy too.
4.Battery is very good. ( 2 days with moderate use)
5.Camera is good it has good dynamic range. ( It has 0.5/1 sec delay in shutter speed, which looks upset)
6. Phone back looks shiny and good (It is prone to scratches easily without case)
7. Call quality, call recording, signal reception, internet works very good.
8.Headphone jack is at top, it could have been in bottom. ( No problem for me)
9. Stock Ui is awesome. No junks to be worried of.
10. Touch and Fingerprint sensor works good.
11. Moto actions/ display are really useful.

Cons:

1.Speaker Sound is average. Even older moto phones has good loud speaker. I don't know whether this needs software update or this is the maximum quality. Very upset with this sound from speaker. Dont buy this phone if speaker volume is your main concern.
Speaker ( 3/5)

2. Camera needs update, it has 0.5 sec-1sec delay in shutter speed.
Camera (4/5)

3. Phone is little thick and bulky in hand but not that weight. Weight balance is very good.

4. Compass sensor is missing. Very bad. (Joke in 2021 by moto )


Other:
The case provided in box will not protect phone from drops. I dropped it once from 4-5 ft height on road accidentally. It had slight scratch on one right bottom edge which is negligible.

Its worth for money.

Overall good phone.
Pros:
1) Stock android experience
2) No unwanted apps or Ads.
3) Unique Moto Gesture for Camera and flash.
4) Thinkshield security
5) Screen Refresh rate of 120Hz.
6) Flash in front(yes it has flash on front as well nicely hidden next to earpiece. Won't be visible easily until you trigger front flash).
7) Long battery life. 6000 Mah will give very good backup to normal user may be between 2 to 2.5 days easily.
8) Overall good all rounder phone for someone who wants decent performance in every area.

Area of Improvement:
1) Camera could have been optimised more efficiently.
2) Long form factor 6.8 inch with weight as 220gms may not suit many for single hand use. This needs to be reduced.
3) No clarity of minimum OS upgrade & minimum years of security.
4) Finger print sensors at back are bit outdated. Could have been on side or under display.
5) Charger should have been 25W as the one given in box is just 20W.
6) Dedicated Google assistant Button may not be useful to many people. Should have been reconfigurable or no need for extra button.
7) Sometimes pushing power button to switch off screen it triggers emergency call.

Fantastic phone for the price range. For me, the only bad thing is kind of its size, sometimes you may need both hands to use the entire screen properly. Would have been great to have a smaller variant. Device is fantastic, regardless. Camera is decent, performance is great. Battery is amazing. If I had to nitpick, an AMOLED screen would have been very nice, but the display is great nonetheless. Plus the 120Hz refresh rate is dreamy, although might affect battery slightly.
All in all, bought this for the pure android experience, and it delivers. Simply beautiful. Thank you!
Fast delivery by Flipkart as well.
P.S. Would be great if Motorola included a screen guard along with back cover as well, it was kind of hard to find a good screen protector in stores. Finally found one online. You might have to search a while for good ones.

In this price range this the best phone you can get in India 🙌

Anyway, here are some PROS & CONS of the device.
[DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE SMALL HANDS]

PROS:
• The DISPLAY is buttery smooth, response rate is good and the display is HUGE but it's very easy to handle the device (I am personally feel confident enough that device won't slip out)
• PERFORMANCE is really really good, I haven't noticed any lag so far
• SOFTWARE, This is one the most beautiful thing about Motorola devices they provide very clean OS and now you can even Customise your moto device now.
• CAMERA is really aesthetic, it's not about the MegaPixel. The aesthetics of the pictures are just very dope
• HUGE BATTERY 6000 mAh 🤷🏻‍♂️
• overall this device is really GREAT

CONS:
• There are literally NO CASED available on market for this device 😂
• You can't interact with MEDIA (play, pause and all stuff) through lock screen, it's kinda annoying
• Doesn't have NFS and Compass Sensor (I don't care about that)
• MACRO LENS, sometimes it takes alot to grab focus 🤷🏻‍♂️ hope they fix it by software update.
• REFRESH RATE, I felt the phone was struggling alot to keep the refresh rate stable. Not really a big issue, it's very minor and screen works perfectly 💯

I personally loved the device, GO FOR IT 🙌💫

This feedback is not really on the product, but about the process of exchange. In one word pathetic from Flipkart. I wanted to exchange an old Moto phone while buying a new one. In the site, the checks which determines the value of the phone were given as screen crack / discoloration / touch isn't working / screen coming out; de-shaped / bent / cracks & part missing. The exchange value was given upto Rs. 2650 & payment was also computed based on that. Since my phone had no issues as per the criteria mentioned, i assumed the exchange value will be around that. When the delivery person from Flipkart came, he started saying that the edge of the phone had undulations etc. It seemed he came ready with it - that he will not give the due exchange amount. I asked him to show me the written criteria against which my phone is failing to qualify. He failed to do so. He said the max. value that can be offered is Rs. 1100. Since he could not show me any written criteria and was not able to connect me to someone with whom I can check on the same, I decided not to argue with him and instead, paid the extra amount & cancelled the exchange. The phone is in a very good condition with no cracks, bends etc., and I preferred to keep it as back up instead of exchanging it for a paltry Rs. 1100. But, the overall experience was very bad. The lack of transparency, clarity ..... something I never expected from Flipkart. Very very bad experience, very bitter. I will never recommend a exchange in Flipkart. I am highly dejected.

So it's been 15 days with my new moto g40 and by this time think I became familiar will all the pros and CONS of this phone , so it comes with a shiny back with clean stock android running on sd 732 , and with a screen refresh rate of 120hz , and ofcourse a massive 6000 mh battery, looks tempting right??? BUT WAIT... all that glitters are not gold...!
The major problem I faced is that the touch is not very responsive to precise movements, which makes playing games, especially shooting games unplayable, editting photos , writing something on the screen is also very difficult. I thought the IPS display would be of good quality becz it's rivals are providing amoled at the same price point, but again I was wrong.... The viewing angles are bad, when compared to my 5yrs old redmi note 3.
ITS SPEAKERS, They are just disaster on this phone , neither it has clearity , nor they have any base , it's just feels like some cheap chineese phone with loud noise.
The CAMERA again is a let down , outdoor pics are somewhat good , but as soon as u come inside, no matter how much light u provide, the pics appear grainy and lack clearity.
The SOFTWARE is neither that smooth that it has to be , since it's kind of stock android so I expected to run smoothly, but there are jitters here and there, and sometimes even the UI crashed with heavy usage.
The READ WRITE speed is less which results in slightly more app opening time, delay in processing photos, delay in savings photos after editting, slow video rendering.
Since it's stock , there are no additional features, it might be a con for some and pro for some.
And last but not the least... It's WEIGHT AND THICKNESS.. I don't have problem carrying heavy phone if it's features are good, but this phone doesn't have anything special which will give me the reason to carry that weight.
As of now this is my experience, I will update it if there is any improvement after software update.
NOTE- Many buyers don't even test it properly before posting a review, I have tested it thoroughly and then I found the above problems, so gamers should stay away from this device because the touch really gives an awfully experience while gaming, for casual use its a wonderful phone.
UPDATE ( AFTER 1MONTH USAGE)- After the 1st software update the touch issue is gone and there is no problem in playing games.
CAMERA- GCAM is available which improves the camera quality. Macro camera is good but the thing is you have to go very close to the subject, unlike the tele photo lense where you get good macro shots from a distance.
BATTERY- ITS SIMPLY AWESOME, on moderate usage with single sim and data on always I get 11-13 hrs of SOT, and even with heavy use I never got sot below 10 hrs.
NETWORK- I get strong 4g+ and the call quality is definitely better than some other devices , it doesn't support wifi tethering.

pros.6000 mAh Battery: This phone comes with a monstrous 6000 mAh battery which is excellent and lasts more than 2 days on normal use. The 20W turbo power charger is blazing fast.
pros.Performance: The Snapdragon 732G processor is super efficient and gives impressive real world performance. It gives a seamless experience when multitasking and gaming.
pros.17.2 cm (6.8) Max Vision display: The display of this phone is amazing and with 120hz refresh rate it gives a smooth gaming and viewing experience. The screen size is big as well which is perfect for media consumption or a joyful gaming experience.

cons.Weight: The phone is a bit bulky and might require two hands to properly handle it.
cons.Camera: The triple rear camera and the front camera are just decent enough at this price range and do not meet the expectations.

summary.verdict: The MOTOROLA G40 Fusion is a must buy if you are looking for an excellent mid range phone with loads of awesome features.
summary.Additional Information: Supports PubG, Comes with backcover, Snapdragon processor.
